summary: Oz'lush is a small, isolated Aj'Snaga-majority settlement of roughly 1,500 people within the state of Slor'th. It sits off any marked trade route, is not a port, and holds no capital status. Daily life centers on subsistence work and a modest shrine to the Slalzanian Deities, with a quiet Kobblin minority and a few families who keep older Aj'Snaga spirit customs.
localColor: Low, tight-knit homes cluster around a communal fireyard where smoke-cured stores hang from rafters. Doorposts bear ochre spirals and knotwork in Aj'Snaga patterns, while prayer-chimes for the Slalzanian Deities tinkle above thresholds. Evenings are hushed save for soft drum patterns and story-recitals; boundary markers of carved wood line the footpaths that fade into the wild.

notables.name: Rethja Orun
notables.role: Practical reeve who coordinates stores, repairs, and disputes for Oz'lush
notables.secret: Has been quietly diverting a portion of communal tithes to fill an unregistered emergency granary, fearing the settlement’s isolation.

notables.name: Mother Valzai
notables.role: Shrine-warden of the Slalzanian Deities and keeper of festival rites
notables.secret: Dreams lead her to an old Aj'Snaga spirit-site nearby; she worries acknowledgment could be branded heresy yet feels the place calls for tending.

notables.name: Brakka Tinbraid
notables.role: Kobblin tinker and itinerant fixer who visits on a loose circuit
notables.secret: Carries discreet messages for a tiny Kobblinist circle hoping to stitch a safer footpath network between isolated hamlets.

notables.name: Sel Vardek
notables.role: Youthful storykeeper who records elders’ tales and boundary lore
notables.secret: Claims to have mapped a hidden cut-through that halves travel time to the next habitation, but it passes a site some consider taboo.

factions.name: Council of Hearths
factions.motive: Keep Oz'lush fed, safe, and self-reliant without depending on outside aid or routes.
factions.strength: Deep community loyalty, detailed knowledge of nearby land, and control of food stores.

factions.name: Shrine of the Slalzanian Deities
factions.motive: Maintain favored rites and moral order, and secure blessings for harvests and health.
factions.strength: Religious authority, festival gatherings, and a small fund of votive offerings.

factions.name: Threadbare Roaders
factions.motive: Establish a discreet footpath chain linking isolated settlements for mutual support.
factions.strength: Mobility, secrecy, and a handful of determined Kobblin traders and guides.

factions.name: Aj'Snaga Storykeepers
factions.motive: Preserve oral histories and ancestral practices without provoking conflict.
factions.strength: Popular youth circles, mnemonic songs, and caches of old boundary-tokens.

adventureHooks.title: The Dry Larder
adventureHooks.setup: Pests and rot have gutted winter stores; with no trade routes in or out, lean days loom.
adventureHooks.complication: Whispers spread that someone hides a secret granary—trust frays as hungry nights approach.
adventureHooks.reward: Public gratitude, a share of reclaimed provisions, and access to the reeve’s off-book cache map.

adventureHooks.title: Dreams in Two Tongues
adventureHooks.setup: The shrine-warden asks for help investigating a site that appears in her dreams and in old Aj'Snaga tales.
adventureHooks.complication: Revealing it may anger orthodox faithful, while quiet spirit-keepers insist it must remain unmarked.
adventureHooks.reward: Blessings, a protective charm from the shrine, and safe lodging whenever the party returns.

adventureHooks.title: The Unmarked Path
adventureHooks.setup: Guides propose cutting a subtle footpath to the nearest burg to break isolation.
adventureHooks.complication: A rival clique prefers Oz'lush remain hard to find and sabotages survey stakes and waymarks.
adventureHooks.reward: Stake in any future tolls, a hand-drawn map of local shortcuts, and favor with the elders.

adventureHooks.title: Bell Without a Tower
adventureHooks.setup: An old gathering bell of Oz'lush is rumored lost in the wild; recovering it could rally the settlement.
adventureHooks.complication: Different groups claim rights to it—some as a sacred relic, others as a sign of unwanted change.
adventureHooks.reward: Public acclaim, a permanent open invitation at longhouses, and first pick of communal work contracts.
